Biography

2024: Graduate transfer from Furman University ... four-time Southern Conference Academic honor roll selection (2021, 2022 & 2023) … in 30 career games (26 starts), has punted 126 times for 5,089 yards (40.39) with 45 boots downed inside the opponent 20-yard line against nine touchbacks ... has 19 punts of 50+ yards … registered a career-long 70-yard punt against The Citadel in 2023 ... punted a career-high 12 times for 461 yards against Montana in 2023 … tallied 4+ punts on 16 occasions and 200+ punting yards 13 times.

PRIOR TO DUKE: Four-year member of the football program at Furman in 2020-21-22-23 … four-time Southern Conference Academic honor roll selection (2021, 2022 & 2023) … in 30 career games (26 starts), has punted 126 times for 5,089 yards (40.39) with 45 boots downed inside the opponent 20-yard line against nine touchbacks ... has 19 punts of 50+ yards … registered a career-long 70-yard punt against The Citadel in 2023 ... punted a career-high 12 times for 461 yards against Montana in 2023 … tallied 4+ punts on 16 occasions and 200+ punting yards 13 times … attended Berkeley Prep and played for coach Dominic Ciao … earned FloridaHighSchool.com Second Team All-State honors in 2018 … helped lead Berkeley Prep to a 7-4 record and an appearance in the state playoffs during junior season … also participated in baseball, recording a 2.37 ERA and going 17-for-17 in stolen base attempts as a junior.

PERSONAL: Born September 28, 2001 ... graduated from Furman in May 2024, with a degree in communications ... currently pursuing a master’s in management studies from Duke’s Fuqua School of Business … son of Jim and Selena Leavy … sister, Paige, lettered four seasons in tennis at Bucknell University (2017-18-19-20), ranking seventh all-time in career doubles victories (64-31), ninth in all-time victories (120), and 13th in career singles wins (56-44) … uncle, Dave Moore, lettered four seasons (1988-89-90-91) in football at the University of Pittsburgh, leading the Panthers in receiving during the 1991 season (51-505) before being drafted in the seventh round (191st selection) of the 1992 NFL Draft by the Miami Dolphins, went on to have a 15-year NFL career with the Dolphins (1992), Tampa Bay Buccaneers (1992-2001; 2004-06) and Buffalo Bills (2002-03) earning Pro Bowl citations in 2006.
